name: Barnes & Noble Education
short_description: Barnes & Noble Education, Inc. operates bookstores for college and university campuses, and K-12 institutions in the United States.
long_description: Barnes & Noble Education, Inc. operates bookstores for college and university campuses, and K-12 institutions in the United States. It operates in three segments: Retail, Wholesale, and Digital Student Solutions (DSS). The Retail segment sells and rents course materials and supplies, including physical and digital products, as well as a suite of digital content; an operates True Spirit e-commerce Websites. It also provides First Day inclusive access program; BNC OER+, a turnkey solution for colleges and universities; and e-textbooks, collegiate and athletic apparel, other custom-branded school spirit products, lifestyle products, technology products, supplies, and convenience items. In addition, this segment also operates 88 customized cafÃ©s and 13 stand-alone convenience stores; and a media channel for brands targeting the college demographic. As of April 27, 2019, this segment operated 772 physical bookstores; and 676 virtual bookstores. The Wholesale segment engages in the wholesale, sourcing, and distribution of new and used textbooks; and sale of hardware and a software suite of applications that provide inventory management and point-of-sale solutions to approximately 400 college bookstores. The DSS segment offers direct-to-student products and services to assist students to study effectively and enhance academic performance. It provides subscription-based writing services; and bartleby, a direct-to-student subscription-based offering, including textbook solutions, expert questions and answers, tutoring, and test prep services. Barnes & Noble Education, Inc. was founded in 1873 and is headquartered in Basking Ridge, New Jersey.
